00036 #ifndef CONSTRAINT_DYNAMIC_SUM_OR_H
00037 #define CONSTRAINT_DYNAMIC_SUM_OR_H
00038 
00039 // For operators
00040 #include "dynamic_vecneq.h"
00041 
00042 template<typename VarArray1, typename VarArray2, typename Operator = NeqIterated, BOOL is_reversed = false>
00043   struct VecCountDynamic : public AbstractConstraint
00044 {
00045   virtual string constraint_name()
00046     { return "VecCountDynamic"; }
00047 
00048   typedef typename VarArray1::value_type VarRef1;
00049   typedef typename VarArray2::value_type VarRef2;
00050 
00051   VarArray1 var_array1;
00052   VarArray2 var_array2;
00053   int num_to_watch;
00054   int hamming_distance;
00055   vector<int> watched_values;
00056   vector<int> unwatched_values;
00057 
00058   Reversible<bool> propagate_mode;
00059   int index_to_not_propagate;
00060 
00061   VecCountDynamic(StateObj* _stateObj, const VarArray1& _array1, const VarArray2& _array2, int _hamming_distance) :
00062   AbstractConstraint(_stateObj), var_array1(_array1), var_array2(_array2), num_to_watch(_hamming_distance + 1), hamming_distance(_hamming_distance),
00063     propagate_mode(_stateObj, false), index_to_not_propagate(-1)
00064     {
00065        if(num_to_watch <= 1)
00066          num_to_watch = 0;
00067        D_ASSERT(var_array1.size() == var_array2.size()); 
00068     }
00069 
00070   int dynamic_trigger_count()
00071   { return Operator::dynamic_trigger_count() * num_to_watch; }
00072 
00073   bool no_support_for_index(int index)
00074   { return Operator::no_support_for_pair(var_array1[index], var_array2[index]); }
00075 
00076 
00077   void add_triggers(int index, DynamicTrigger* dt)
00078   {
00079     Operator::add_triggers(var_array1[index], var_array2[index], dt);
00080   }
00081 
00082   virtual void full_propagate()
00083   {
00084     
00085     // Check if the constraint is trivial, if so just exit now.
00086     if(num_to_watch <= 1)
00087       return;
00088       
00089     watched_values.resize(num_to_watch);
00090       
00091     DynamicTrigger* dt = dynamic_trigger_start();
00092     int size = var_array1.size();
00093     int index = 0;
00094     int found_matches = 0;
00095     // Find first pair we could watch.
00096     
00097     while(found_matches < num_to_watch && index < size)
00098     {
00099       while(index < size && no_support_for_index(index))
00100       {
00101         ++index;
00102       }
00103       if(index != size)
00104       {
00105         watched_values[found_matches] = index;
00106         ++found_matches;
00107         ++index;
00108       }
00109     }
00110     
00111     // Failed to find enough watches
00112     if(found_matches < num_to_watch - 1)
00113     {
00114       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00115       return;
00116     }
00117 
00118     // Found exactly as many values as we need to propagate
00119     if(found_matches == num_to_watch - 1)
00120     {
00121       index_to_not_propagate = -1 ;
00122       propagate_mode = true;
00123       for(int i = 0; i < num_to_watch - 1; ++i)
00124       {
00125         propagate_from_var1(watched_values[i]);
00126         propagate_from_var2(watched_values[i]);
00127         add_triggers(watched_values[i], dt + Operator::dynamic_trigger_count()*i);
00128       }
00129       return;
00130     }
00131 
00132     // Found enough values to watch, no propagation yet!
00133     for(int i = 0; i < num_to_watch; ++i)
00134     {
00135       add_triggers(watched_values[i], dt + Operator::dynamic_trigger_count()*i);
00136     }
00137     
00138     // Setup the 'unwatched values' array.
00139     initalise_unwatched_values();
00140   }
00141   
00142   void initalise_unwatched_values()
00143   {
00144     unwatched_values.resize(0);
00145     for(int i = 0; i < var_array1.size(); ++i)
00146     {
00147       bool found = false;
00148       for(int j = 0; j < watched_values.size(); ++j)
00149       {
00150         if(i == watched_values[j])
00151           found = true;
00152       }
00153       if(!found)
00154         unwatched_values.push_back(i); 
00155     }
00156     
00157     random_shuffle(unwatched_values.begin(), unwatched_values.end());
00158   }
00159 
00160   void propagate_from_var1(int index)
00161   { Operator::propagate_from_var1(var_array1[index], var_array2[index]); }
00162   
00163   void propagate_from_var2(int index)
00164   {  Operator::propagate_from_var2(var_array1[index], var_array2[index]); }
00165 
00166   virtual void propagate(DynamicTrigger* dt)
00167   {
00168     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(DynVecNeq);
00169     int trigger_activated = dt - dynamic_trigger_start();
00170     int triggerpair = trigger_activated / Operator::dynamic_trigger_count();   
00171     D_ASSERT(triggerpair >= 0 && triggerpair < num_to_watch);
00172 
00173     printf("propmode=%d, triggerpair=%d, trigger_activated=%d\n",
00174       (int)propagate_mode, (int)triggerpair, (int)trigger_activated);
00175 
00176     for(int i = 0; i < watched_values.size(); ++i)
00177       printf("%d,", watched_values[i]);
00178     
00179     printf(":");  
00180     for(int i = 0; i < unwatched_values.size(); ++i)
00181       printf("%d,", unwatched_values[i]);
00182     printf("\n");
00183     
00184     for(int i = 0; i < var_array1.size(); ++i)
00185       cout << var_array1[i].getMin() << ":" << var_array1[i].getMax() << ",";
00186     
00187     cout << endl;
00188     
00189     for(int i = 0; i < var_array2.size(); ++i)
00190       cout << var_array2[i].getMin() << ":" << var_array2[i].getMax() << ",";
00191     
00192     cout << endl;
00193     
00194     
00195     if(propagate_mode)
00196     {
00197       if(index_to_not_propagate == watched_values[triggerpair])
00198         return;
00199         
00200     // assumes that the first set of Operator::dynamic_trigger_count()/2 triggers are on var1, and the other set are on var2.
00201       if(trigger_activated % Operator::dynamic_trigger_count() < Operator::dynamic_trigger_count()/2)
00202       { propagate_from_var1(watched_values[triggerpair]); }
00203       else
00204       { propagate_from_var2(watched_values[triggerpair]); }
00205       return;   
00206     }
00207 
00208     // Check if propagation has caused a loss of support.
00209     if(!no_support_for_index(watched_values[triggerpair]))
00210       return;
00211 
00212     int index = 0;
00213     int unwatched_size = unwatched_values.size();
00214     while(index < unwatched_size && no_support_for_index(unwatched_values[index]))
00215       index++;
00216       
00217     if(index == unwatched_size)
00218     {
00219       // This is the only possible non-equal index.
00220       propagate_mode = true;
00221       index_to_not_propagate = watched_values[triggerpair];
00222       
00223 //     printf("!propmode=%d, triggerpair=%d, trigger_activated=%d, nopropindex=%d\n",
00224 //        (int)propagate_mode, (int)triggerpair, (int)trigger_activated, (int)index_to_not_propagate);
00225         
00226       for(int i = 0; i < watched_values.size(); ++i)
00227       {
00228         if(i != triggerpair)
00229         {
00230           propagate_from_var1(watched_values[i]);
00231           propagate_from_var2(watched_values[i]);
00232         }
00233       }
00234       return;
00235     }
00236 
00237     swap(watched_values[triggerpair], unwatched_values[index]);
00238     
00239     DynamicTrigger* trigs = dynamic_trigger_start();
00240     add_triggers(watched_values[triggerpair], trigs + triggerpair * Operator::dynamic_trigger_count());
00241   }
00242 
00243   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00244   {
00245     int v_size1 = var_array1.size();
00246     int count = 0;
00247     for(int i = 0; i < v_size1; ++i)
00248       if(Operator::check_assignment(v[i], v[i + v_size1]))
00249         count++;
00250     return (count >= hamming_distance);
00251   }
00252 
00253   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00254   { 
00255     vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
00256     vars.reserve(var_array1.size() + var_array2.size());
00257     for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array1.size(); ++i)
00258       vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(var_array1[i]));
00259     for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array2.size(); ++i)
00260       vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(var_array2[i]));
00261     return vars;  
00262   }
00263   
00264   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00265   {
00266     if(num_to_watch <= 1)
00267       return true;
00268     
00269     pair<int, int> assign;
00270     int found_satisfying = 0;
00271     for(int i = 0; i < var_array1.size(); ++i)
00272     {
00273       if(Operator::get_satisfying_assignment(var_array1[i], var_array2[i], assign))
00274       {
00275         found_satisfying++;
00276         D_ASSERT(var_array1[i].inDomain(assign.first));
00277         D_ASSERT(var_array2[i].inDomain(assign.second));
00278         D_ASSERT(Operator::check_assignment(assign.first, assign.second));
00279         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, assign.first));
00280         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i + var_array1.size(), assign.second));
00281         if(found_satisfying == hamming_distance)
00282           return true;
00283       }
00284     }
00285     // If we didn't get enough, 
00286     return false;
00287   }
00288   
00289   virtual AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
00290    { return rev_implement<is_reversed>(); }
00291 
00292   template<bool b> 
00293    typename disable_if_c<b, AbstractConstraint*>::type rev_implement()
00294    {
00295      return new VecCountDynamic<VarArray1, VarArray2, typename Operator::reverse_operator, true>
00296          (stateObj, var_array1, var_array2, var_array1.size()-hamming_distance+1);
00297    }
00298 
00299    template<bool b>
00300    typename enable_if_c<b, AbstractConstraint*>::type rev_implement()
00301      { FAIL_EXIT(); }
00302   
00303   
00304   
00305 };
00306 
00307 template<typename VarArray1,  typename VarArray2>
00308 AbstractConstraint*
00309   VecOrCountConDynamic(StateObj* stateObj,const VarArray1& varray1, const VarArray2& varray2, int i)
00310   { return new VecCountDynamic<VarArray1,VarArray2>(stateObj, varray1, varray2, i); }
00311 
00312 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00313 AbstractConstraint*
00314 BuildCT_WATCHED_HAMMING(StateObj* stateObj, const T1& t1, const T2& t2, ConstraintBlob& b) 
00315 { return VecOrCountConDynamic(stateObj, t1, t2, b.constants[0][0]); }
